criteria: Understanding of Similarity Criteria (AA, SAS, SSS) and Congruence Criteria (SSS, SAS, ASA, AAS, HL)
Application of Similarity and Congruence Criteria in Proofs
Problem Solving Using Similarity and Congruence
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of similarity or congruence criteria.
Student shows minimal understanding, struggling to recall or identify criteria.
Student can recall some criteria but has difficulty applying them correctly.
Student accurately identifies and recalls similarity and congruence criteria but may struggle to explain their application in detail.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding of similarity and congruence criteria, accurately applying them in most situations.
Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of all similarity and congruence criteria and can explain and apply them flawlessly.
Student is unable to construct any proofs or apply criteria.
Student attempts to construct proofs but makes significant errors in logic or application of criteria.
Student can construct basic proofs but struggles with more complex problems or justifications.
Student constructs proofs with minor errors and generally applies similarity and congruence criteria correctly.
Student constructs accurate and well-reasoned proofs using similarity and congruence criteria effectively.
Student constructs flawless and elegant proofs, demonstrating a deep understanding of geometric relationships and providing clear, concise justifications.
Student is unable to solve problems related to similarity and congruence.
Student attempts to solve problems but demonstrates a lack of understanding of the concepts.
Student can solve some basic problems but struggles with multi-step problems or real-world applications.
Student can solve most problems involving similarity and congruence with reasonable accuracy.
Student solves problems accurately and efficiently, demonstrating a strong understanding of how to apply the criteria.
Student solves complex and novel problems related to similarity and congruence with ease, demonstrating a mastery of the concepts.
